info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 12:23PM PDT until August 21 at 3:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 330 PM PDT. * At 1223 PM PDT, Water from the significant flash flooding in upper Kyle and Lee Canyons continues to move downstream and will continue to impact the lower slopes of Mount Charleston. Flash flooding is ongoing. Please avoid the area as officials continue to access the damage. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Video and gauges reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rainbow Canyon, Mt. Charleston, Spring Mountains, Hilltop Campground, Mahogany Grove Campground, Kyle Canyon Campground, Fletcher View Campground, Mary Jane Falls Campground, Dolomite Campground and Mcwilliams Campground. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
